pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:1.2: “Nunnery” renders upassaya. According to the word definition below, this includes any place where a nun stays. In other words, it spans anything from a single hut, see Bi Pc 35, to a monastery. The Jain text The Ācārāṅga-sūtra, contains a passage that describes an upassaya as including a grassy area, that is, it must have been a compound of buildings or a monastery: “A layman might, for the sake of a mendicant ... cutting and clipping the grass outside or within the upāśraya (= upassaya).” See Jacobi, Hermann, trans. “Jaina Sutras Part I”. Motilal Babarsidass, 1964, p. 94.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.1.16: “A formal meeting of the community”, saṁvāsa, is defined at Bu Pc 69:2.1.21, as the observance-day ceremony, the invitation ceremony, or a legal procedure.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc23:3.3.5: That osāreti must mean “recite” can be seen from Bu Pc 4:2.3.5 where there is no offense if osārentaṁ opāteti, “he prompts one who is osārentaṁ.” The difference between uddesaṁ deti and osāreti is not clear to me.
